mmj.util

Class Boss

  • java.lang.Object
    • mmj.util.Boss
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GMFFBoss, GrammarBoss, LogicalSystemBoss, MacroBoss, OutputBoss, ProofAsstBoss, StoreBoss, SvcBoss, TheoremLoaderBoss, TMFFBoss, VerifyProofBoss, WorkVarBoss

    public abstract class Boss
extends java.lang.Object
    Boss is the superclass of GrammarBoss, LogicalSystemBoss, etc, which are used by BatchFramework to "exercise" mmj2 in batch mode.

    Boss consists of the abstract "doRunParmCommand" and some common parameter validation functions used in sub-classes of Boss.

      • buildPrintWriter

        protected java.io.PrintWriter buildPrintWriter(java.io.File filePath,
                                               java.lang.String fileNameParm,
                                               java.lang.String fileUsageParm,
                                               java.lang.String fileCharsetParm)
        Construct a PrintWriter using RunParm options.
        Parameters:
        filePath - path for building files. May be null, absolute or relative.
        fileNameParm - RunParmFile line parsed into RunParmArrayEntry.
        fileUsageParm - "new" or "update"
        fileCharsetParm - optional, "UTF-8", etc.
        Returns:
        PrintWriter object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an error occurred

      • getSelectorCount

        protected int getSelectorCount(int valueFieldNbr)
        Get SelectorCount RunParm Option.

        If "*" input returns Integer.MAX_VALUE, if positive integer input returns integer value, otherwise, if negative or zero integer, throws an exception. If none of the above returns 0.

        Parameters:
        valueFieldNbr - number of field in RunParm line.
        Returns:
        0 for non-integer values, the number if integer

      • getSelectorTheorem

        protected Theorem getSelectorTheorem(int valueFieldNbr,
                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Stmt> stmtTbl)
        Get SelectorTheorem RunParm Option if present or null.

        If present, and not a valid Theorem label, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        valueFieldNbr - number of field in RunParm line.
        stmtTbl - stmtTbl map from LogicalSystem.
        Returns:
        Theorem or null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an error occurred
